text: Olive Dutton Green (February 1878 – 5 July 1930) was a noted Australian artist, born in Adelaide, a daughter of politician and real-estate agent George Dutton Green (1850–1911). She moved to London around 1910. Studied under Frank Spenlove-Spenlove. Painted in post-impressionist style. Exhibited in Adelaide, London Paris. Member of the South Australian Society of Arts; Society of Women Artists; Royal Institute of Oil Painters. Green died in Hampstead, London after a long illness. She was survived by her mother and her two sisters. == References == Category:Australian artists Category:Australian women artists Category:1878 births Category:1930 deaths
title: Olive Dutton Green
